member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.BitmapImageOptions.Default
member.summary:
The default option, which selects an appropriate image creation strategy based on how large the bitmap is, whether it is an IBitmapSource or IBitmap, the amount of available GPU memory, and whether the device context is using hardware or software rendering.
Depending on which strategy is used to create the image for the device context, the bitmap may be copied to the to the GPU (cached), or streamed during rendering.
The bitmap's colors will be converted to the color space of the device context, if available and if possible, unless the option is specified.
The image will use premultiplied alpha unless the option is specified. The bitmap will be premultiplied or unpremultiplied as necessary.
NOTE: The bitmap should not be modified after the image is created in order to guarantee correct rendering results. If the bitmap is modified after the image is created, results are undefined.
member.remarks: This is the recommended option for the best balance between performance and memory consumption.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.BitmapImageOptions.DoNotCache
member.summary: The source bitmap is not copied to the GPU. Instead, it is streamed on-demand as portions of it are needed for rendering. If the same portion of the bitmap is rendered multiple times, it will be streamed again. No caching is used.
member.remarks:
This option guarantees the least memory consumption, but not the best performance, especially when the device context is using hardware rendering. The source bitmap should not be modified after the image is created in order to guarantee consistent rendering results.
This option can be appropriate if the image will only be rendered exactly once.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.BitmapImageOptions.UseStraightAlpha
member.summary: This option ensures that the image uses straight alpha instead of premultiplied alpha. If the bitmap is in a premultiplied alpha format then it will be unpremultiplied. If the bitmap is in a straight alpha format then it will not be premultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.BitmapImageOptions.DisableColorSpaceConversion
member.summary: Use this option to prevent the image from being converted to the device context's color space. This is usually only needed for advanced scenarios where you are performing your own color management.
member.remarks: When this option is specified, the property will either be the color context supplied to CreateImageFromBitmap(), or the default color context for the bitmap's pixel format.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DeviceContextExtensions.CreateBufferedImage(PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceImage)
member.summary: Creates a buffered version of the given image. This can be used to work around limitations in Direct2D's effect rendering system that can result in an when an is used both in an effect graph and in a command list.
member.remarks:
If you get an for an effect graph that otherwise looks correct, use this method to wrap any s that are used by command lists which are part of the effect graph that is causing the error. The command list(s) at fault may not be yours; they are often contained within s, for instance. The may still be set as the input for the , but the other nodes in the effect graph should use the wrapper created by this method.
When the Direct2D debug layer and Visual Studio's mixed-mode debugging ("Enable debugging for managed and native code together") are both enabled, you would see the following error:
A command list cannot reference effects which are part of effect graphs that consume the command list. See also: D1159: Invalid Command List topology
An example of an effect graph that can cause this error:
IDeviceImage --> SampleMapRenderer | | | | v v CompositeEffect
In this example, the is used as an input for both a SampleMapRenderer and a . The SampleMapRenderer, which implements , internally uses several effects and command lists to produce its output. In this case, the SampleMapRenderer should still be given the original IDeviceImage, while the CompositeEffect should use the buffered image:
IDeviceImage --> SampleMapRenderer | | v | IBufferedImage | | | v v CompositeEffect

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DeviceContextExtensions.CreateCommandList(PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext,System.Action{PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext})
member.param: A delegate, called before this method returns, that issues the drawing commands for the command list.
member.returns: A that is populated with the drawing commands issued by .

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DeviceContextExtensions.CreateImageFromBitmap(PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext,PaintDotNet.Imaging.IBitmapSource,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceColorContext,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.BitmapImageOptions)
member.summary: Creates an image that renders the given bitmap. This method supports bitmaps of arbitrary sizes and in many pixel formats, whereas CreateBitmap() is limited by the MaximumBitmapSize property and requires that the bitmap be in a pixel format natively supported by Direct2D (e.g. indexed or straight alpha pixel formats are not supported).
member.remarks:
The bitmap may be cached or streamed depending on various factors, including the bitmap type (IBitmap or IBitmapSource), its size, the maximum bitmap size supported by the device context, the amount of available GPU memory, and whether hardware or software rendering is being used.
NOTE: The bitmap should not be modified after the image is created in order to guarantee correct rendering results. If the bitmap is modified after the image is created, results are undefined.
The bitmap will be converted to a format that is suitable for rendering with Direct2D. For instance, if the bitmap is not in a premultiplied alpha format, it will be premultiplied unless the option is specified. Indexed pixel formats are also supported. Alpha8 bitmaps will be converted to a mask where each pixel is colored white and using the source bitmap's alpha value.
The bitmap will be converted to the color space associated with the device context, if any. This ensures, for example, that sRGB bitmaps (which is most of them) can be drawn correctly when rendering to a device context that uses linear gamma. Note that it is not always possible to determine the color contexts to use for conversion. If that is the case, color space conversion will not be performed.
Premultiplication and conversions are either performed on the GPU, or while copying the bitmap to the GPU. The bitmap is not modified by this method.
member.param: The to use for creating resources.
The or to create an for.

The optionally specified color context information. This will be used when converting to the device context's color space. If null is specified then the default color context for the bitmap's pixel format will be used (e.g. sRGB for Bgra32, scRGB for Rgba128Float).
The options for creating the image.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DeviceContextExtensions.CreateBitmapSourceFromImage``1(PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext,PaintDotNet.Rendering.SizeInt32,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceImage)
member.summary:
Creates an that renders the given into CPU accessible memory.
If the is using hardware acceleration, rendering will be performed on the GPU and then copied to CPU memory. This is done on-demand when is called. No caching is used.
member.remarks:
For this method overload, the pixel format of the rendering buffer will match the pixel format of the . Some effects require higher precision buffers to render correctly (e.g. distortion effects that use SampleMapRenderer). In that case, use the
overload and specify something like .
Note: The pixel format of the must use premultiplied alpha.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DeviceContextExtensions.CreateBitmapSourceFromImage``1(PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceContext,PaintDotNet.Rendering.SizeInt32,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDeviceImage,PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.DevicePixelFormat)
member.remarks:
Use this overload to specify a pixel format for the rendering buffer. Some effects require higher precision buffers to render correctly (e.g. distortion effects that use SampleMapRenderer). In that case you can specify for the pixel format. The GPU will be used to convert from the buffer's pixel format to the 's pixel format.
Note: The pixel format of the must use premultiplied alpha.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.AlphaMaskEffect2
member.summary:
Similar to , but also supports Straight alpha via configuring the AlphaMode property.
This effect applies an alpha mask to an image. It has two inputs, named Destination and Mask. Color values in the Destination image are multiplied by the alpha channel of the Mask image.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.AlphaMaskEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the image, and the alpha mode of the output.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceEffect2
member.summary:
Similar to , but has improved performance and reduced functionality.
This effect will stream the bitmap source to the GPU as needed; the bitmap is not cached.
This effect will copy the pixels from the bitmap source directly to GPU memory, and as such will only work with pixel formats that can be copied directly to the GPU. It will not perform premultiplication, pixel format conversion, or color space conversion, nor will it ensure that the alpha channel contains opaque values for pixel formats that do not support alpha (such as Bgr32). Mipmap chains are also not supported.
For most purposes, it is recommended to use which will perform format conversions from pixel formats that cannot be directly copied to the GPU (e.g. Bgr24, indexed formats, etc.), and will ensure pixel formats like Bgr32 have an opaque alpha chanel.
member.remarks:
If you are using a bitmap in a straight alpha pixel format, such as Bgra32, you should use this effect as the input to a unless you are certain that the next effect in the graph is expecting straight alpha pixel values (most do not).
If you are using a bitmap in a pixel format that does not have an alpha channel, such as Bgr32, you must ensure that all pixels are actually encoded with an opaque alpha channel. Otherwise rendering may be incorrect. You can use the to ensure that the alpha channel is opaque.
The following pixel formats are supported: Alpha8, Bgr32, Bgra32, Pbgra32, Rgba64, Prgba64, Rgb64Half, Rgba64Half, Prgba64Half, Rgb128Float, Rgba128Float, and Prgba128Float.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceEffect2.Props.OpacityMetadata
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha content of the input image, which affects the opacity metadata for the output image.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceOpacityMetadata
member.summary: Specifies the opacity metadata for an when using the effect.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceOpacityMetadata.Default
member.summary: The opacity metadata for the effect's output is determined by the pixel format of the bitmap source. For pixel formats that do not have an alpha channel (e.g. Bgr32, Rgb64Half, Rgb128Float), the output will be marked as opaque, which can improve rendering performance.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceOpacityMetadata.NotOpaque
member.summary: The opacity metadata for the effect's output is not marked as opaque. This will still produce correct rendering results if an image is fully opaque, but performance may be lower.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BitmapSourceOpacityMetadata.Opaque
member.summary: The opacity metadata for the effect's output is always marked as opaque. This can improve rendering performance if you are using a pixel format that supports an alpha channel but you know that all pixels in the bitmap are opaque. Using this with a bitmap that does contain pixels with non-opaque pixels can result in incorrect rendering.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendEffect2
member.summary:
Similar to , but with different blend modes. Includes the layer blend modes from Paint.NET that are not supported by , such as Xor. Does not include the blend modes that are supported by .
The classic "Normal" blend mode from Paint.NET is equivalent to or .
The inputs are converted to straight alpha if the AlphaMode property is set to Premultiplied. The blend mode is applied, then the result is clamped to the range [0, 1]. Lastly, the output is premultiplied if the AlphaMode property is set to Premultiplied.
For a convenient way to use any blend or composite mode, see .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendEffect2.Props.Destination
member.summary: The destination image, which is used as the "under" (bottom) blending layer.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendEffect2.Props.Source
member.summary: The source image, which is used as the "over" (top) blending layer

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendEffect2.Props.Mode
member.summary: Specifies the blend mode to use.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode of the input and output. The default is Premultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Additive
member.summary:
The source and destination colors are summed.
output = dst + src

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Reflect
member.summary:
The source colors are reflected over the destination colors.
output = min(1, (dst * dst) / (1 - src))

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Glow
member.summary:
The inverse of Reflect.
output = min(1, (src * src) / (1 - dst))

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Negation
member.summary:
The source colors are negated over the destination colors.
output = (1 - abs(1 - dst - src))

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Min
member.summary:
The minimum of each color channel is used.
output = [R=min(dst.R, src.R), G=min(dst.G, src.G), B=min(dst.B, src.B)]

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.Max
member.summary:
The maximum of each color channel is used.
output = [R=max(dst.R, src.R), G=max(dst.G, src.G), B=max(dst.B, src.B)]

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.XorInt8
member.summary: The source and destination colors are XOR'd together using 8-bits of precision.
member.remarks:
"8-bits of precision" refers to the normalized range of [0.0f, 1.0f]. Pixel values outside of that normalized range are not clamped and will still work, but very large values may not have enough precision to work correctly.
The pixel values are multiplied by 255.0f, cast to integers, xor'd together, then cast back to float, and finally divided by 255.0f.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BlendMode2.XorInt16
member.summary: The source and destination colors are XOR'd together using 16-bits of precision.
member.remarks:
"16-bits of precision" refers to the normalized range of [0.0f, 1.0f]. Pixel values outside of that normalized range are not clamped and will still work, but very large values may not have enough precision to work correctly.
The pixel values are multiplied by 65535.0f, cast to integers, xor'd together, then cast back to float, and finally divided by 65535.0f.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurEffect
member.summary:
Use the Bokeh blur effect to give an out-of-focus appearance to an image.
See Bokeh (Wikipedia) for more information.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurEffect.Props.Radius
member.summary:
The radius of the bokeh effect. A value of 0 will disable the blur effect.
The valid range is [0, 300], the default is 25.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurEffect.Props.Quality
member.summary:
The quality of the bokeh effect. Performance is affected linearly. For example, a quality of 6 takes about twice as long to render as a quality value of 3.
The range is [1, 10] and the default is 3.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurEffect.Props.EdgeMode
member.summary:
Specifies how samples outside the bounds of the input image are calculated.
If this value is Transparent, the effect pads the image with transparent pixels as it applies the blur kernel, resulting in a soft edge. The output will be larger than the input by approximately the blur radius, in pixels. If set to another edge mode, the effect clamps the output to the size of the input image.
The default value is Transparent.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode for the input and output. The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect
member.summary: This effect simulates the ability to have a per-pixel value for the blur radius of a . This is implemented as a linear interpolation across many copies of the image blurred at various radius levels.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect.Props.Input
member.summary: Provides the input image for the effect.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect.Props.RadiusMap
member.summary: Provides an image where each pixel's alpha component specifies the radius for blurring at that location. Depending on the value of the property, this image should either have normalized values in the [0, 1] range, or non-normalized values that are in the [0, ] range.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect.Props.MaxRadius
member.summary:
Specifies the maximum blur radius that is rendered. If the contains pixels specifying a blur radius larger than this value, then they will be clamped to this value.
The range of this value is [0, 300]. The default value is 30.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect.Props.RadiusLevels
member.summary:
Specifies the number of blur levels to be rendered. The image will be blurred this many times with an exponentially increasing blur radius based on the value of . Increasing this value will improve quality, but also reduce performance.
The range of this value is [1, 30]. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BokehBlurMapEffect.Props.MapIsNormalized
member.summary:
Specifies whether the input image is normalized.
If this value is true, the map's alpha values are expected to be in the range [0, 1]. The blur radius at each pixel will be the map's alpha value multiplied by .
If this value is false, the map's alpha values are used directly.
The default value is true, which affords easily using the output of most effects as the map input for this effect.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEdgeMode2.Clamp
member.summary: Repeats the pixels from the edges of the image.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEdgeMode2.Wrap
member.summary: Uses pixels from the opposite end edge of the image.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEdgeMode2.Mirror
member.summary: Reflects pixels about the edge of the image.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEdgeMode2.Transparent
member.summary: Extends the boundaries of the image without changing its appearance.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEffect2
member.summary: Similar to , but adds the Transparent edge mode. This can be used to extend an image's bounds to infinity while not affecting its appearance. Unlike , the edge mode cannot be set separately for X and Y directions.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BorderEffect2.Props.EdgeMode
member.summary: The edge mode for the effect. The default value is BorderEdgeMode2.Clamp.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.BoundsAdjustmentPrefixTransform
member.summary:
A layout transform that records the size of the input's output rect and forwards that to be the output rect for a BoundsAdjustmentTransform.
This transform should be placed at the start of a transform graph, and the BoundsAdjustmentTransform should be placed toward the end of the transform graph.
The output will then be cropped to the size of the input image, or the rect calculated by the virtual method.
[Input] -> [BoundsAdjustmentPrefixTransform] --> ... --> [BoundsAdjustmentTransform] -> [Output] | ^ | | +------> outputRect ------+

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ClampEffect
member.summary: Clamps the pixel values of the input image to a valid range.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ClampEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input image.
If set to ClampAlphaMode.Premultiplied, each pixel's alpha value is clamped to the range [0, 1] and then the RGB values are clamped to the range [0, alpha].
If set to ClampAlphaMode.Straight, all components are clamped to the range [0, 1].
The default value is ClampAlphaMode.Premultiplied.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ClampEffect.Props.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the effect. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is useful when creating an effect graph where the should be conditionally enabled based on other state. This makes it possible to avoid rebuilding the effect graph just for the sake of enabling or disabling clamping.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ColorManagementEffect2
member.summary: Similar to , but adds an Enabled property.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ColorManagementEffect2.Props.Quality
member.summary: The quality level of the transform. The default value is ColorManagementQuality.Best.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaEffect
member.summary:
This effect converts an input image from one alpha format to another. It uses the or depending on the value of the property.
This effect may be more convenient than using or depending on the nature and configuration of the effect graph you are working with.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaEffect.Props.Mode
member.summary: Specifies the conversion type. The default is , which leaves the input unchanged.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode for the .

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaMode.Premultiply
member.summary: The input will be converted from straight alpha to premultiplied alpha.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaMode.UnPremultiply
member.summary: The input will be converted from premultiplied alpha to straight alpha.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertAlphaMode.Passthrough
member.summary: The input will be unchanged.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaEffect
member.summary:
This effect is used to convert the gamma of an input image. Conversion can be done from sRGB to Linear, Linear to sRGB, or a custom exponent can be used.
Conversion between sRGB and Linear uses the or , which implements a gamma exponent approximately equal to 2.2. See The sRGB Learning Curve for more information.
If a custom exponent is used, then is used.
Images are usually encoded using sRGB, and most effects are implemented in the Linear gamma space. Therefore, it is more accurate to convert an image from sRGB to Linear before other effects are used for processing. The image should then be converted back from Linear to sRGB.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaEffect.Props.Mode
member.summary: Specifies the gamma conversion mode. The default value is Passthrough, which leaves the input unchanged.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaEffect.Props.CustomExponent
member.summary: Specifies the gamma exponent for when Mode is set to or . The default value is 1.0.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output. The default is Premultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaMode.SrgbToLinear
member.summary: The is used to convert the input image from sRGB (~2.2) to Linear (1.0).

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaMode.LinearToSrgb
member.summary: The is used to convert the input image from Linear (1.0) to sRGB (~2.2).

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaMode.CustomExponent
member.summary: The is used to apply a custom gamma exponent.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaMode.InverseCustomExponent
member.summary: The is used to apply the reciprocal of a custom gamma exponent.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvertGammaMode.Passthrough
member.summary: The input image is unchanged.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.KernelSizeX
member.summary: The width of the kernel matrix. The units are specified in kernel units. The default value is 3.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.KernelSizeY
member.summary: The height of the kernel matrix. The units are specified in kernel units. The default value is 3.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.KernelMatrix
member.summary:
The kernel matrix to be applied to the image. The kernel elements aren't bounded and are specified as floats. The first set of KernelSizeX numbers in the FLOAT[] corresponds to the first row in the kernel. The second set of KernelSizeX numbers correspond to the second row, and so on up to KernelSizeY rows.
The default value is { 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0 }.
Use the method for a convenient way to set both KernelMatrix and KernelSizeX/Y from a 2-dimensional array.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.KernelTileSize
member.summary:
Specifies the tiling size for the kernel matrix. This should be set to lower values, such as 64 or 128, for 2-dimensional kernel matrices. Large values, such as 1024 or 2048, are good for 1D kernel matrices.
The default is 64.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.EdgeMode
member.summary:
Specifies how samples outside of the image should be calculated.
If set to Transparent, the output size is larger than the input by the size of the kernel matrix.
Otherwise, the output size is the same as the input size.
The default is Transparent.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.SetKernelMatrixAndSize(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Single}})
member.summary: A helper method that sets the KernelMatrix, KernelY, and KernelX properties.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect2.Props.SetKernelMatrixAndSize(System.Single[0:,0:])
member.summary: A helper method that sets the KernelMatrix, KernelY, and KernelX properties.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CroppedFloodEffect
member.summary:
Combines and to create a cropped solid color fill effect.
This effect also supports configuring the alpha mode for the color and the output.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CroppedFloodEffect.Props.Color
member.summary:
The color and opacity of the output. This effect will premultiply the color values if the property is set to , which is the default and is usually the correct choice.
The default value is { R=0, G=0, B=0, A=1} (opaque black).

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CroppedFloodEffect.Props.Rect
member.summary: The region of the output. The default value is { -float.Max, -float.Max, +float.Max, +float.Max }, which results in no cropping.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CroppedFloodEffect.Props.BorderMode
member.summary:
Specifies how the border of the cropped region is treated.
BorderMode.Soft will apply antialiasing if the crop rectangle falls on fractional pixel coordinates.
BorderMode.Hard will result in clamping and a hard edge.
The default value is BorderMode.Soft.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CroppedFloodEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the output. If this is set to , the color will be premultiplied, which is usually the correct choice.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.CrossFadeMaskEffect
member.summary:
Similar to , but uses a mask image to do a per-pixel cross-fade between two images.
A SourceMask alpha value of 0 will use the pixel from Destination, while a value of 1 will use the pixel from Source, and 0.5 will take the average.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.EmptyEffect
member.summary: An effect that produces no output.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FillOutputRectEffect
member.summary:
Generates an axis-aligned rectangle that fills the output rectangle of the input.
Note that this effect does not know about images with irregular or transformed shapes. For instance, if the input is an with a rotation transform matrix, the output area will cover the axis-aligned bounding rectangle of the rotated image. If you want the the output to also be rotated, and to have a soft border, you must use the untransformed image as the input to this effect, and then use this effect as the input to another transform effect (e.g. ) with the same transform properties.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FillOutputRectEffect.Props.Color
member.summary: Specifies the color of the output. The default value is { 1, 1, 1, 1 } (opaque white).

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FillOutputRectEffect.Props.TransformMatrix
member.summary: The transform for the output rectangle. The default value is the identity matrix, which results in no transform.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FillOutputRectEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the output should be premultiplied. The default value is .

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FloodAlphaMode2.Straight

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FloodEffect2
member.summary:
Use this effect to generate an image based on the specified color and alpha value.
This effect is similar to , but uses a instead of a for specifying the color, along with the alpha mode. This effect will automatically premultiply the color value unless the alpha mode is set to .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FloodEffect2.Props.Color
member.summary:
The color and opacity of the bitmap. This effect will premultiply the color values if the property is set to , which is the default and is usually the correct choice.
The default value is { R=0, G=0, B=0, A=1} (opaque black).

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.FloodEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the output. If this is set to , the color will be premultiplied, which is usually the correct choice.
The default value is .

member.summary: Similar to , but allows specifying the alpha format of the input and output.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GammaTransferEffect2.Props.AlphaMode

Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurEffect2
member.summary:
Provides the same functionality as , but adds a HighQuality mode that does not apply any optimizations or shortcuts that reduce image quality. When using the HighQuality mode, rendering quality is greatly improved for images that are gamma corrected or that have a low dynamic range (such as when using a large gamma exponent), but performance is greatly reduced.
NOTE: The maximum value for the StandardDeviation property is much lower than for .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurEffect2.Props.StandardDeviation
member.summary:
The amount of blur to be applied to the image. You can compute the blur radius of the kernel by multiplying the standard deviation by 3. You can compute the standard deviation by dividing the blur radius by 3. The units of both the standard deviation and blur radius are DIPs. A value of zero disables this effect entirely.
You can use the class to simplify conversion between standard deviation and radius.
The range of this value is [0, 100], which corresponds to a blur radius of [0, 300].
The default value is 3.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurEffect2.Props.Optimization
member.summary: The optimization mode. The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurEffect2.Props.BorderMode
member.summary:
The mode used to calculate the border of the image.
When set to BorderMode.Soft, the effect pads the image with transparent black pixels as it applies the blur kernel, resulting in a soft edge. The output will be larger than the input by approximately StandardDeviation*3 pixels (the blur radius) when using the Speed, Balanced, or Quality optimizations. The output will be larger than the input by approximately StandardDeviation*6 pixels when using the HighQuality optimization.
When set to BorderMode.Hard, the effect clamps the output to the size of the input image. When the effect applies the blur kernel, it extends the input image with a mirror-type border transform for samples outside of the input bounds.
The default value is BorderMode.Soft.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect
member.summary: This effect simulates the ability to have a per-pixel value for the blur radius (standard deviation) of a . This is implemented as a linear interpolation across many copies of the image blurred at various radius levels.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.Input
member.summary: Provides the input image for the effect.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.StandardDeviationMap
member.summary: Provides an image where each pixel's alpha component specifies the standard deviation for blurring at that location. Depending on the value of the property, this image should either have normalized values in the [0, 1] range, or non-normalized values that are in the [0, ] range.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.MaxStandardDeviation
member.summary:
Specifies the maximum blur radius (standard deviation) that is rendered. If the contains pixels specifying a standard deviation larger than this value, then they will be clamped to this value.
The range of this value is [0, 100]. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.StandardDeviationLevels
member.summary:
Specifies the number of blur levels to be rendered. The image will be blurred this many times with an increasing blur radius based on the value of . Increasing this value will improve quality, but also reduce performance.
The range of this value is [1, 30]. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.MapIsNormalized
member.summary:
Specifies whether the input image is normalized.
If this value is true, the map's alpha values are expected to be in the range [0, 1]. The standard deviation at each pixel will be the map's alpha value multiplied by .
If this value is false, the map's alpha values are used directly.
The default value is true, which affords easily using the output of most effects as the map input for this effect.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.Optimization
member.summary: The optimization mode. The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurMapEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GaussianBlurOptimization2.HighQuality
member.summary:
No internal optimizations are applied, and no shortcuts are taken to improve performance. This produces the highest quality output, but performance is significantly reduced.
This is typically only necesary for images that are gamma corrected, or those with a low dynamic range, such as when amplifying with a high gamma value, such as seen in Paint.NET's built-in Gaussian Blur and Bokeh effects.
It is not recommended to use this with software rendering.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GrayscaleEffect2
member.summary: Similar to , but can also be configured for sRGB or linear gamma. This also necessitates the specification of straight vs. premultiplied alpha.
member.remarks: Note that this effect calculates the luma for the image's color values, which is different than luminance. See Difference between Luma and Luminance for more information.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GrayscaleEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input and output. The default is Premultiplied.
To preserve color information for transparent pixels, make sure the input is in straight alpha format (not premultiplied) and set this property to Straight.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.GrayscaleEffect2.Props.InputGamma
member.summary:
Indicates the gamma of the input image, and for the output. If the input image is known to be linear, then the value should be used so that the correct calculations are used.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSelectorEffect
member.summary: An effect with variable number of inputs, and a property to select which input is used as the output. This effect can be useful for changing an effect graph without having to rebuild it.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSelectorEffect.Props.Index
member.summary: Sets which input is used as the output. If the input count is 0, or if the value of Index is invalid (including negative values), then the output will be empty. The default value is 0.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect
member.summary:
Swizzles the channels from a variable number of inputs. You can specify the input index and channel that corresponds to each output channel.
This effect supports any number of inputs, but only 4 can be used at once. Use to specify the number of inputs.
If you are only swizzling from 1 input, it is recommended to use the instead.
output = new Color( Input[RedInputIndex][RedInputChannel], Input[GreenInputIndex][GreenInputChannel], Input[BlueInputIndex][BlueInputChannel], Input[AlphaInputIndex][AlphaInputChannel]);

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.RedInputIndex
member.summary:
Specifies which input to use for the output's red channel.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.RedInputChannel
member.summary:
Specifies which channel to read from the RedInputIndex for the output's red channel.
The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.GreenInputIndex
member.summary:
Specifies which input to use for the output's green channel.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.GreenInputChannel
member.summary:
Specifies which channel to read from the GreenInputIndex for the output's green channel.
The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.BlueInputIndex
member.summary:
Specifies which input to use for the output's blue channel.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.BlueInputChannel
member.summary:
Specifies which channel to read from the BlueInputIndex for the output's blue channel.
The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.AlphaInputIndex
member.summary:
Specifies which input to use for the output's alpha channel.
The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.AlphaInputChannel
member.summary:
Specifies which channel to read from the AlphaInputIndex for the output's alpha channel.
The default value is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InputSwizzleEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the inputs and the output.
If this value is , the inputs will be unpremultiplied, then the swizzling will be performed, and then the result will be premultiplied.
If this value is , the swizzling will be performed directly without any premultiplication or unpremultiplication.
The default value is .

member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output. The default value is Premultiplied, which results in the input being unpremultiplied (converted to straight alpha), then the alpha channel is inverted, then the result is premultiplied and used as the output.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InvertEffect2
member.summary: Similar to , but does not require a premultiplied input. This means that color information can be preserved for transparent pixels when the input is in straight alpha format and is set to .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.InvertEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input and output. To preserve color information for transparent pixels, make sure the input is in straight alpha format (not premultiplied) and set this property to Straight.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.summary: Converts an image from linear scRGB (gamma 1.0) to companded sRGB (gamma ~2.2).
member.remarks:
This effect is the inverse of .
This is a helper effect that is the same as using the with the SourceColorContext initialized to and the DestinationColorContext set to .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.LinearToSrgbEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the alpha mode for the input and the output. The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.LinearToSrgbEffect.Props.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the effect. The default value is true.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MakeOpaqueEffect
member.summary:
Forces the input image to be opaque. This is useful when working with an image source that is in the BGR32 pixel format, as the "alpha" channel may be zero or uninitialized.
This effect is usually used with a as the input.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MakeOpaqueEffect.Props.InputAlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input. If this is , , or , the alpha channel will be set to 1 (opaque) without changing the RGB channels.
If this is set to , the input will be un-premultiplied first. This will cause transparent pixels to become opaque black.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixEffect
member.summary:
Provides composite modes, blend modes, and alpha masking in the same effect.
This is the same as using the , , , or depending on which mode you want to use. This effect provides all of those modes in one effect which can be more convenient. It also performs automatic alpha-mode conversion when necessary and as specified by the AlphaMode property.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixEffect.Props.Mode
member.summary: Specifies the mixing mode. The default is .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the input and output.
This effect will premultiply or unpremultiply the inputs based on the value of this property and what the mix mode requires, and then unpremultiply or premultiply the output based on the value of this property.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixMode
member.summary: Provides composite modes, blend modes, and alpha masking. These modes are aggregated from CompositeMode, BlendMode, BlendMode2, and the AlphaMaskEffect.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixMode.CompositeSourceOver
member.remarks: This mode operates in premultiplied alpha space. If the AlphaMode property is set to Straight then the input will be premultiplied, the operation will be performed, and then the output will be unpremultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixMode.BlendMultiply
member.remarks: This mode operates in premultiplied alpha space. If the AlphaMode property is set to Straight then the input will be premultiplied, the operation will be performed, and then the output will be unpremultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixMode.Blend2Additive
member.remarks: This mode operates in straight alpha space. If the AlphaMode property is set to Premultiplied then the input will be unpremultiplied, the operation will be performed, and then the output will be premultiplied.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.MixMode.AlphaMask
member.summary:
Applies an alpha mask from the source to the destination.
Color values in the destination are multiplied by the alpha channel of the source.
Direct2D Alpha mask effect for more information.
member.remarks: This mode operates in premultiplied alpha space. If the AlphaMode property is set to Straight then the input will be premultiplied, the operation will be performed, and then the output will be unpremultiplied.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PassthroughEffect
member.summary: This effect does not modify the input, serving instead as a passthrough node. This can be used to adjust caching, or simply as a way to wrap an (such as an or ) as an effect. This permits providing an to another component, while retaining the ability to change the image without communicating with the other component (s are immutable, and s cannot be resized or have their pixel format changed).
member.remarks: Note that changes to the Precision property will have no effect. Use the for this purpose instead.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PixelSwizzleEffect
member.summary:
Swizzles the pixels of an input. This can be used to change the order of channels, or to to duplicate (broadcast) channels. For instance, to swap the red and green channels, set the Swizzle property to . As another example, to broadcast the green channel to all output channels, use .
You may use either RGBA or XYZW notation for channel names. Using is the same as .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PixelSwizzleEffect.Props.Swizzle
member.summary: Specifies the swizzling to be performed. The default value is , which effectively does no swizzling.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PixelSwizzleEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input and output.
If set to , the input will be unpremultiplied, then swizzling will be performed, and then the output will be premultiplied.
If set to , the input will be swizzled without unpremultiplication or premultiplication.
The effect may also skip the premultiplication/unpremultiplication steps if it is not necessary for the given swizzle (such as when the alpha channel is not modified). The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2
member.summary: Similar to , but permits up to 256 value counts instead of 16, supports posterizing the alpha channel, and can work on both straight and premultiplied inputs.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.RedValueCount
member.summary: An integer value specifying how many evenly spaced steps to divide the red channel range of 0.0 to 1.0 into. For example, a value of 4 generates a table with 4 steps, [0.0, 0.33, 0.67, 1.0]. The allowed range for this property is 2 to 256. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.RedDisable
member.summary: If set to true, the red channel is not processed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.GreenDisable
member.summary: If set to true, the green channel is not processed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.BlueValueCount
member.summary: An integer value specifying how many evenly spaced steps to divide the blue channel range of 0.0 to 1.0 into. For example, a value of 4 generates a table with 4 steps, [0.0, 0.33, 0.67, 1.0]. The allowed range for this property is 2 to 256. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.BlueDisable
member.summary: If set to true, the blue channel is not processed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.AlphaDisable
member.summary: If set to true, the alpha channel is not processed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PosterizeEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary: Sets the alpha mode for the input and output. The default value is Premultiplied.

member.summary: Adjusts the precision of an image. Use the Precision property to modify an image's precision.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PremultiplyEffect2
member.summary: This effect produces the same output as , but also has a property to enable or disable premultiplication. This simplifies creating transform or effect graphs that may or may not need to use premultiplication depending on their own configuration.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.PremultiplyEffect2.Props.Enabled
member.summary:
Enables or disables premultiplication. If this is set to true, then this effect uses the to premultiply the input. Otherwise, this effect serves as a passthrough node and does not change the input.
The default value is true.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.RandomNoiseEffect

Specifies the random seed for the effect. If two instances of this effect have the same value for their Seed property, they will generate the same output.
The default value is 0. You can set this to (uint)Random.Shared.Next() to make sure each instance of the effect has different output.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ReplaceChannelEffect
P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ReplaceChannelEffect.Props.ChannelSource
member.summary: The image that contains the channel that will be replaced in the Input image.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ReplaceChannelEffect.Props.Channel
member.summary:
This selects which channel will be replaced in the Input image.
The default value is , which replaces the alpha channel.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ReplaceChannelEffect.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the inputs and the output.
If this value is , the inputs will be unpremultiplied, then the channel replacement will be performed, and then the result will be premultiplied.
If this value is , the channel replacement will be performed on the input images without any further processing.
The effect may also skip the premultiplication/unpremultiplication steps if it is not necessary for the given channel replacement (such as when the alpha channel is not being modified).
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionEffect
member.summary:
An effect whose output at each location is the scene position. This can be useful for sample map effects that take a sample map as input, and produce a sample map as an output. If this effect is plugged into the SampleMapRenderer as the SampleMap input, the output will be the same as the Input image.
The scene position enumerates center-of-pixel offsets, such as { x = 0.5, y = 0.5 }, instead of whole-integer offsets, such as { x = 0, y = 0 }. If you prefer to have whole-integer offsets, pass the output of this effect to an with the Function property set to .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionEffect.Props.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the scene position values. See for more information.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionFormat
member.summary: Specifies the output format of the .

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionFormat.XY01
member.summary: The scene position will be provided as { X, Y, 0, 1 }. This can be used as the input value for a sample map effect or the SampleMapRenderer, in which case it is essentially the identity transform.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionFormat.Raw
member.summary:
The scene position will be the exact value returned from .
See also D2DGetScenePosition function.
The Z and W components contain values used for calculating texture offsets and can be useful in very advanced scenarios for low-level pixel shaders.
These values may not be interpreted correctly if used in sample map effects, which expect values in the form {X, Y, *, A}.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ScenePositionFormat.XY00
member.summary: The scene position will be provided as { X, Y, 0, 0 }.

member.summary: Similar to , but matches Paint.NET's original Sepia effect.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.SepiaEffect2.Props.Intensity
member.summary:
The intensity of the effect. The range is [0, 1] and the default is 0.5.
If 0.5 is used, this effect produces the same output as the original, parameterless Paint.NET Sepia effect.
If 0 is used, this effect produces the same output as .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.SepiaEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode of the input and output. The default is Premultiplied.
To preserve color information for transparent pixels, make sure the input is in straight alpha format (not premultiplied) and set this property to Straight.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.SepiaEffect2.Props.InputGamma
member.summary:
Indicates the gamma of the input image, and for the output. If the input image is known to be linear, then the value should be used so that the correct calculations are used.
The default value is .

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ShadowEffect2
member.summary:
Provides the same functionality as , but adds a mode that does not apply any optimizations that reduce image quality. When using the mode, rendering quality is greatly improved for certain types of images, but performance is also greatly reduced.
NOTE: The maximum value for the BlurStandardDeviation property is much lower than for .

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ShadowEffect2.Props.BlurStandardDeviation
member.summary:
The amount of blur to be applied to the alpha channel of the image. You can compute the blur radius of the kernel by multiplying the standard deviation by 3. You can compute the standard deviation by dividing the blur radius by 3. The units of both the standard deviation and blur radius are DIPs. A value of zero disables this effect entirely.
You can use the class to simplify conversion between standard deviation and radius.
The range of this value is [0, 100], which corresponds to a blur radius of [0, 300].
The default value is 3.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ShadowEffect2.Props.Color
member.summary: The color of the drop shadow. You must specify this color in straight alpha (not premultiplied). The default value is { 0, 0, 0, 1 } (opaque black).

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ShadowEffect2.Props.Optimization
member.summary: The level of performance optimization. The default value is ShadowOptimization2.HighQuality.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.ShadowEffect2.Props.AlphaMode
member.summary:
Specifies the alpha mode for the output. Because this effect operates only on the input's alpha channel, it does not matter if the input is in straight or premultiplied alpha format.
The default value is Premultiplied.

member.summary: Converts an image from companded sRGB (gamma ~2.2) to linear scRGB (gamma 1.0).
member.remarks:
This effect is the inverse of .

member.summary: Enables or disables the effect. The default value is true.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.UnPremultiplyEffect2
member.summary: This effect produces the same output as , but also has a property to enable or disable unpremultiplication. This simplifies creating transform or effect graphs that may or may not need to use unpremultiplication depending on their own configuration.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.UnPremultiplyEffect2.Props.Enabled
member.summary:
Enables or disables unpremultiplication. If this is set to true, then this effect uses the to unpremultiply the input. Otherwise, this effect serves as a passthrough node and does not change the input.
The default value is true.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.WeightedAverageEffect
member.summary:
Combines multiple images by calculating their weighted average. This is an order-independent form of blending.
Each input is first multiplied by its corresponding weight. Then, all of these are summed together. Finally, the output is the summation of the weighted inputs divided by the summation of the weights.
output[x,y] = sum(inputs[0] * weights[0] + ... + inputs[n-1] * weights[n-1]) / sum(weights)
The use of premultiplied alpha images is recommended for correct alpha handling.

member.name: P:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.Effects.WeightedAverageEffect.Props.Weights
member.summary:
Specifies the weights for each input image. If the number of values in the list is less than the number of inputs, then the list is extended with {1, 1, 1, 1} weights.
Weights are specified on per-component basis.
The default value is an empty list, which means that the weight value for each input is {1, 1, 1, 1}.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDynamicEffect
member.summary: A dynamic effect is an that provides metadata properties for DisplayName, Author, Category, and Description.
member.remarks:
The difference between an and an is intention, not functionality. s are intended as public APIs that can be gathered using reflection and displayed in a UI, such as a node/graph editor, alongside regular s. If an is not an , then it should not be considered an "effect" that can be surfaced in a UI that works with effects (such as a node/graph editor).
The effect properties are intended to be presented to the user and should not be relied upon to have any specific text or pattern. They may be changed at any time, and may be localized (translated).

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDynamicImage
member.summary: A dynamic image is a that is similar to an effect (), but typically uses rendering techniques that are either not possible or performance-prohibitive within the context of an effect implementation.
member.remarks:
NOTE: Due to limitations in the Direct2D effects and rendering systems, inputs to dynamic images that are also used in effect graphs may need to be wrapped in an when used outside of the dynamic image. You can use the extension method for this. See that method for more details.
NOTE: Dynamic images usually require the device context's target to be using a buffer precision of for correct rendering.
If your target is lower precision, use to create an off-screen buffer to render the dynamic image into, and then draw the compatible device context's bitmap to the final render target (device context).

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDynamicImage.GetOutput
member.summary: Gets the underlying image or effect graph.
member.remarks:
You do not need to call this method again if you change the 's inputs or properties.
NOTE: This method does not need to be used in order to draw the dynamic image. It is only necessary when inspecting the underlying image or effect graph, in which case you should also call before beginning that inspection.

member.name: M:PaintDotNet.Direct2D1.IDynamicImage.UpdateOutput
member.summary: Ensures that the underlying image or effect graph has been updated for the latest property changes, as well as for any layout changes to the inputs.
member.remarks: NOTE: This method does not need to be used before drawing the dynamic image. It is only necessary when inspecting the underlying image or effect graph (via before drawing it, either after creating the dynamic image or after changing its inputs or properties.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Gdi.GdiControl
member.summary:
A control that does its painting in WM_PAINT via GDI calls, completely bypassing System.Drawing (GDI+) and WinForm's built-in painting mechanisms. You will need to implement your own interop definitions to paint using GDI. Use of the TerraFX.Interop.Windows nuget package is highly recommended.
The passed to implements the interface, which is accepted by some rendering code in the System.Windows.Forms namespaces, such as , , and .
This class primarily exists to serve as the base class for Direct2DControl.

Creates an adapter that reinterprets a bitmap in a straight alpha pixel format over to a premultiplied alpha pixel format, such as from to .
The adapter can then be used for Direct2D rendering, such as with .
A copy is not made; the adapter references the same memory as the original bitmap.

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Imaging.PremultipliedAdapterOptions.PremultiplyOnCreate
member.summary: The contents of the bitmap are converted to premultiplied alpha at the time the adapter is created. Using this option enables the correct rendering of Direct2D content on top of non-Direct2D content. This option is not necessary if the bitmap is blank (filled with transparent black, or is completely opaque).

member.name: F:PaintDotNet.Imaging.PremultipliedAdapterOptions.UnPremultiplyOnDispose

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Rendering.BezierSplineUtil
member.summary: Bezier Spline methods
member.remarks:
Modified: Peter Lee (peterlee.com.cn _at_ gmail.com) Update: 2009-03-16
see also: Draw a smooth curve through a set of 2D points with Bezier primitives http://www.codeproject.com/KB/graphics/BezierSpline.aspx By Oleg V. Polikarpotchkin
Algorithm Descripition:
To make a sequence of individual Bezier curves to be a spline, we should calculate Bezier control points so that the spline curve has two continuous derivatives at knot points.
Note: `[]` denotes subscript `^` denotes supscript `'` denotes first derivative `''` denotes second derivative
A Bezier curve on a single interval can be expressed as:
B(t) = (1-t)^3 P0 + 3(1-t)^2 t P1 + 3(1-t)t^2 P2 + t^3 P3 (*)
where t is in [0,1], and 1. P0 - first knot point 2. P1 - first control point (close to P0) 3. P2 - second control point (close to P3) 4. P3 - second knot point
The first derivative of (*) is:
B'(t) = -3(1-t)^2 P0 + 3(3t^24t+1) P1 + 3(23t)t P2 + 3t^2 P3
The second derivative of (*) is:
B''(t) = 6(1-t) P0 + 6(3t-2) P1 + 6(13t) P2 + 6t P3
Considering a set of piecewise Bezier curves with n+1 points (Q[0..n]) and n subintervals, the (i-1)-th curve should connect to the i-th one:
Q[0] = P0[1], Q[1] = P0[2] = P3[1], ... , Q[i-1] = P0[i] = P3[i-1] (i = 1..n) (@)
At the i-th subinterval, the Bezier curve is:
B[i](t) = (1-t)^3 P0[i] + 3(1-t)^2 t P1[i] + 3(1-t)t^2 P2[i] + t^3 P3[i] (i = 1..n)
applying (@):
B[i](t) = (1-t)^3 Q[i-1] + 3(1-t)^2 t P1[i] + 3(1-t)t^2 P2[i] + t^3 Q[i] (i = 1..n) (i)
From (i), the first derivative at the i-th subinterval is:
B'[i](t) = -3(1-t)^2 Q[i-1] + 3(3t^24t+1) P1[i] + 3(23t)t P2[i] + 3t^2 Q[i] (i = 1..n)
Using the first derivative continuity condition:
B'[i-1](1) = B'[i](0)
we get:
P1[i] + P2[i-1] = 2Q[i-1] (i = 2..n) (1)
From (i), the second derivative at the i-th subinterval is:
B''[i](t) = 6(1-t) Q[i-1] + 6(3t-2) P1[i] + 6(1-3t) P2[i] + 6t Q[i] (i = 1..n)
Using the second derivative continuity condition:
B''[i-1](1) = B''[i](0)
we get:
P1[i-1] + 2P1[i] = P2[i] + 2P2[i-1] (i = 2..n) (2)
Then, using the so-called "natural conditions":
B''[1](0) = 0
B''[n](1) = 0
to the second derivative equations, and we get:
2P1[1] - P2[1] = Q[0] (3)
2P2[n] - P1[n] = Q[n] (4)
From (1)(2)(3)(4), we have 2n conditions for n first control points P1[1..n], and n second control points P2[1..n].
Eliminating P2[1..n], we get (be patient to get :-) a set of n equations for solving P1[1..n]:
2P1[1] + P1[2] + = Q[0] + 2Q[1] P1[1] + 4P1[2] + P1[3] = 4Q[1] + 2Q[2] ... P1[i-1] + 4P1[i] + P1[i+1] = 4Q[i-1] + 2Q[i] ... P1[n-2] + 4P1[n-1] + P1[n] = 4Q[n-2] + 2Q[n-1] P1[n-1] + 3.5P1[n] = (8Q[n-1] + Q[n]) / 2
From this set of equations, P1[1..n] are easy but tedious to solve.

member.name: T:PaintDotNet.Threading.WaitHandleArray
member.summary: Encapsulates an array of WaitHandles and methods for waiting on them. This class does not take ownership of the WaitHandles; you must still Dispose() them yourself.
member.remarks: This class exists because System.Threading.WaitHandle.Wait[Any|All] will throw an exception in an STA apartment. So we must P/Invoke down to WaitForMultipleObjects().
